title: Isamaa, Center sign Tallinn coalition agreement
description:
Tallinn's new government plans to boost support for families, the transition to Estonian-language education, and ensure the city contributes to the country's economic development.

Representatives of the Center Party and Isamaa signed a coalition agreement on Monday to govern the city of Tallinn for...

title: Investors and companies quitting Tallinn stock exchange
description:
Investors and listed companies are leaving the Nasdaq Tallinn exchange. Joakim Helenius says it should shut down and merge with the Stockholm exchange.

Over the past couple of months, the world's largest investment fund — the $2 trillion Norwegian Oil Fund — has liquidated most of its portfolio on ...

title: UAE and Estonia Strengthens Cooperation in the Digital Economy and Innovation Sectors
description:
Estonian ICT Trade Mission to UAE Explored Joint Investment Opportunities

title: Estonia's economic growth in third quarter of 2025 stood at 0.9%
description:
Gross domestic product (GDP) in Estonia rose by 0.9 percent on year to the third quarter of 2025 (Q3 2025), state agency Statistics Estonia reported.

GDP at current prices totaled €10.5 billion in Q3 2025, the agency said. Economic growth continued at the same pace as in the previous quarter.

title: NATO: Estonia's prime minister Kaja Kallas signals her interest in Nato's top job
description:
Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas (Reuters file photo)

title: Australia Appoints New Ambassador To Estonia 30 November
description:
Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

Today I announce the appointment of Mr Edmund Mortimer as Australia's next Ambassador to the Republic of Estonia.
